Package org.example.mini.model

Class Table

java.lang.Object
org.example.mini.model.Table
public class Table extends Object
Represents the state of the table during a game.

The Table keeps track of the cards that have been played and the accumulated sum of their values according to the game rules. It also provides utility operations used when recycling cards back into the deck.

      public Table()

  • Method Details

    • placeCard

      public boolean placeCard(Card card)
      Places a card on the table if the move is valid.

      This is a convenience method that assumes the player is human and delegates to placeCard(Card, boolean) with isHumanPlayer = true.

      Parameters:
      card - the card to place
      Returns:
      true if the card was placed successfully, false if placing it would cause the sum to exceed 50

    • placeCard

      public boolean placeCard(Card card, boolean isHumanPlayer)
      Places a card on the table if the move is valid.

      The effective value of the card is computed via Card.getGameValue(int, boolean), taking into account whether the player is human (for example, for Ace behaviour). If adding this value to the current table sum would exceed 50, the card is not placed and the method returns false.

      Parameters:
      card - the card to place on the table
      isHumanPlayer - true if the card is played by a human player, false if played by a CPU player
      Returns:
      true if the card was placed and the sum updated, false if the move was invalid (sum would exceed 50)

    • getLastCard

      public Card getLastCard()
      Returns the last card placed on the table.
      Returns:
      the most recently played Card, or null if the table is empty

    • getTableSum

      public int getTableSum()
      Returns the current sum of the values of all cards on the table.
      Returns:
      the accumulated table sum

    • getCards

      public List<Card> getCards()
      Returns all cards currently on the table.

      A defensive copy is returned to prevent external modification of the internal list.

      Returns:
      a new List containing all cards on the table

    • setTableSum

      public void setTableSum(int value)
      Sets the current sum of the table to the specified value.
      Parameters:
      value - the new total value to assign to the table

    • getCardCount

      public int getCardCount()
      Returns the current number of cards held in this collection.
      Returns:
      the total count of cards in cards

    • removeAllButLastCard

      public List<Card> removeAllButLastCard()
      Removes all cards from the table except the last one and recalculates the sum.

      This is typically used when recycling cards back into the deck: all but the most recently played card are removed and returned, while the table keeps only that last card. The tableSum is recalculated using the basic value of the remaining card.

      Returns:
      a list containing all removed cards (all except the last one); if there are zero or one cards on the table, an empty list is returned

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the table (clears all cards and sets sum to 0)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a short textual representation of the table.

      The format is "Table{sum=&lt;sum&gt;, cards=&lt;count&gt;}", where sum is the current table sum and count is the number of cards.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing the table state
